intro: Iresine calea, commonly known as the crimson flame plant, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its striking, velvety red leaves that resemble flames. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellow in color. Iresine calea thrives in warm, humid environments and prefers well-draining soil. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant foliage.
